Subject: When Did We Get Cool? The SFF Explosion on Screen
Description: In a world where some of the most watched shows deal with SFF themes or have been adapted from SFF material (Game of Thrones, The Walking Dead, The Lord of the Rings/The Hobbit, The Avengers et. al.) where does the “mainstream” line get drawn?  Why is it suddenly acceptable for the SFF genre to be viewed?  Has this translated over to the written word?  Side question: why has mystery always been more or less accepted but SFF is a more recent explosion?  Speakers include:Ernie Cline, Sean M. Davis, Michael Cieslak, Nicole Castle, Jim Leach, John Scalzi - Track: Lit  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Ask the Authors
Description: A small panel followed by open Q&A/Suggestions.  Speakers include:Ernie Cline, Mary Lynne Gibbs, Cory Doctorow, John Scalzi    - Track: Lit  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: The Future of Virtual Reality
Description: With the Oculus Rift being bought by media giant Facebook, the cautionary tales of science fiction seem closer than ever to reality.  Join authors Ernie Cline and John Scalzi, and Android VR creator Gameface Labs, as they talk about where our communal virtual fantasy is headed.  Speakers include:Ernie Cline, Ed Mason, John Scalzi - Track: Tech  - Duration: 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none

Subject: Author Readings
Description: Readings by Literature Track Guests and Panelists  Speakers include:Ken MacGreggor, Mary Lynne Gibbs, Nicole Castle, John Scalzi, Sean M. Davis - Track: Lit  - Duration: 1 hour and 50 minutes - Audio/video needs: none
